intro: Brassica cretica subsp. aegaea, commonly known as the Aegean mustard, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from spring to early summer. The plant is characterized by its robust root system and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils.
